Exponential Function
a m x+n = b x p +q ⇒ x = q lnb − n lna coefficient no ' x s m n l a − p lnb ' xs
Numerator: multiply q with lnb minus multiply n with ln a
Denominator: multiply m with ln a minus multiply p with lnb
Proof
ln a mxn+ = lnb pxq+ (mxn )ln a = ( pxq )lnb + + + mx ln a + n ln a = px lnb q lnb mx ln a − px lnb = q lnb n− ln a x ( lnm a − p ln ) b = q lnb n− ln a
q lnbn ln a − x = m x ln a + n ln a = px lnb + q lnb m ln a − p lnb
Example
2x − 1 x + 1 Solve: 3 = 7 Solution
ln3+ x = 2ln3− ln 7 l 7n
Example
Solve: 4 x+ 3 = 3 − x
Solution
−ln x = − 3ln 4 4 1x+ ln 3 3 − 1x ln4 + l3n −ln

Trigonometry
Proof
Triangle DCB: tanα = h ⇒ h = (50 + x )tanα 50 + x
Triangle ACB: tan β = h ⇒ h = x tan β x x tan β = (50 x+ )tanα
x tan β = 50tan +α x tanα x tan β − x tanα = 50tanα
x (tan β − tanα ) 50tan= α
x = 50tanα tan β − tanα
50tan tanα β h = x tan β tanα −
Height is equal to distance times (tan tan) divides by the (tan(larger angle) − tan) (difference between tangents)
Example
From a given point on the ground, the angle of elevation to the top of a tree is 36.7°. From a second point, 50 feet back, the angle of elevation to the top of the tree is 22.2°. Find the height of the tree to the nearest foot.
Solution
h = 50 tan22.2 tan36.7° ° tan36.7°− tan22.2°
≈ 45 ft
